description: Complete slot mapping guide for programmatic PSUR generation

slot_syntax.appearance: Blue italic text in Word document
slot_syntax.replacement_method: Search and replace {{slot:slot_name}} with actual content

data_collection_period.label: Data Collection Period:
data_collection_period.format: DD Month YYYY to DD Month YYYY

previous_actions.label: Actions and status from Previous Report:
previous_actions.guidance: State actions from previous PSUR or 'This is the first PSUR...'
previous_actions.example: This is the first PSUR for the Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor device family...

nb_reviewed.label: Previous PSUR Reviewed by Notified Body:

nb_actions_taken.label: Notified Body Actions Taken:
nb_actions_taken.example: Not applicable. This is the initial PSUR.

benefit_risk_unchanged.label: has NOT been adversely impacted and remains UNCHANGED

benefit_risk_summary.label: Benefit-Risk Summary
benefit_risk_summary.guidance: 1-3 paragraphs: devices distributed, complaint rate %, serious incidents, findings, conclusion
benefit_risk_summary.example: The comprehensive analysis of post-market surveillance data collected during the reporting period from 01 January 2024 through 31 December 2025 supports the conclusion that the Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor maintains a favorable benefit-risk profile. Throughout this period, approximately 6,183 devices were distributed globally, with a total of 15 complaints recorded. This represents an overall complaint rate of approximately 0.243 percent. No serious incidents were reported during the surveillance period...

classification_rule.label: Classification Rule:
classification_rule.example: Rule 6 - Surgically invasive devices intended for transient use

projected_end_pms.label: Projected end of PMS period:
projected_end_pms.example: Cannot be determined - device actively marketed

psur_obligation.label: Confirmation of ongoing PSUR obligation:
psur_obligation.example: PSUR obligation CONTINUES - device actively marketed

device_description.label: Device Description:
device_description.guidance: 1-3 paragraphs covering physical design, materials, sterility, packaging, technology
device_description.example: The Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor is a single-use, sterile electrosurgical electrode designed to remove a conical shaped specimen from the cervix during LEEP procedures...

intended_purpose.label: Intended Purpose/Use:
intended_purpose.example: The Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor is intended to remove a conical shaped specimen from cervix during LEEP procedure.

indications.label: Indications:
indications.example: Large Loop Excision of the Transformation Zone (LLETZ) in the diagnosis and treatment of Cervical Intraepithelial Neoplasias (CIN) and dysplasias...

contraindications.label: Contraindications:
contraindications.example: Absolute contraindications include hypovolemic shock, cardiac decompensation (Class IV), coagulopathy...

target_populations.label: Target populations:
target_populations.example: Women identified for treatment of Cervical Intraepithelial Neoplasias (CIN) where a cone biopsy specimen is removed...

date_range.label: Date Range:
date_range.format: DD Month YYYY to DD Month YYYY

device_lifetime.label: Device Lifetime:
device_lifetime.example: Shelf life as indicated on product labeling (single use device)

projected_end.label: Projected end of PMS period:
projected_end.example: Cannot be determined while device remains actively marketed

grouping_information.label: Device Grouping Information:
grouping_information.example: The Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor family includes 8 catalog numbers representing variations in cone electrode size...

sales_criteria_*.label: Various sales criteria checkboxes
sales_criteria_*.guidance: One checkbox for each criterion listed

market_history.label: Market History:
market_history.example: The Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor has been available since 2006, when it was first introduced to the market by Apple Medical Corporation...

sales_analysis.label: Sales Data Analysis:
sales_analysis.example: The sales data shows total distribution of 6,183 devices during the surveillance period from January 2024 through December 2025...

population_size.label: Estimated Size of the Patient Population:
population_size.example: Based on the total of approximately 6,183 devices distributed during the surveillance period and the single-use nature of the device...

population_characteristics.label: Characteristics of Patient Population:
population_characteristics.example: The patient population consists of women identified for treatment of Cervical Intraepithelial Neoplasias (CIN)...

section_d_content.label: Serious Incidents Summary:
section_d_content.guidance: Include Tables 2, 3, 4 with IMDRF coding, rates, and investigation conclusions
section_d_content.example: Throughout the surveillance period from 01 January 2024 through 31 December 2025, no serious incidents were reported...

section_e_content.label: Customer Feedback Summary:
section_e_content.example: Customer feedback was reviewed through the procedure for Post-Market Surveillance. During the surveillance period, no formal customer feedback distinct from product complaints was identified...

section_f_content.label: Complaint Types and Rates:
section_f_content.guidance: Include complaint rate calculation, Table 7 with rates by harm/problem
section_f_content.example: The complaint rate is calculated as the number of complaints received during the period divided by the estimated number of device uses. During the surveillance period, 15 complaints were received for 6,183 units distributed, yielding a complaint rate of approximately 0.243 percent.

section_g_content.label: Trend Reporting:
section_g_content.guidance: Monthly complaint rate graph, UCL analysis, trend reports
section_g_content.example: Statistical process control analysis was conducted to evaluate complaint rates throughout the surveillance period. No sustained upward trends, cyclical patterns, or systematic shifts were identified...

section_h_content.label: Field Safety Corrective Actions:
section_h_content.example: No Field Safety Corrective Actions were initiated during the data collection period from 01 January 2024 through 31 December 2025.

section_i_content.label: Corrective and Preventive Actions:
section_i_content.example: No CAPAs were initiated during the surveillance period related to device design, manufacturing process, or safety issues.

section_j_content.label: Scientific Literature Review:
section_j_content.guidance: Search methodology, findings, impact on benefit-risk
section_j_content.example: Systematic literature review was conducted covering the surveillance period. Literature searches confirmed that LEEP and cone biopsy procedures remain accepted standards of care...

section_k_content.label: External Databases Review:
section_k_content.example: External regulatory databases were systematically monitored throughout the surveillance period including FDA MAUDE and other relevant databases...

section_l_content.label: Post Market Clinical Follow-Up:
section_l_content.guidance: PMCF activities, findings, Table 11, or state N/A if not required
section_l_content.example: Post-market clinical follow-up activities were conducted throughout the surveillance period. No formal prospective PMCF studies were required...

section_m_content.label: Findings and Conclusions:
section_m_content.guidance: Include sections a) through f): benefit-risk determination, benefits achieved, data limitations, new risks, actions, overall conclusion
section_m_content.example: a) Benefit-Risk Determination: Based on comprehensive analysis of all surveillance data collected during the period from 01 January 2024 through 31 December 2025, the benefit-risk profile of Fischer Cone Biopsy Excisor has NOT been adversely impacted and remains UNCHANGED...

replacement_process: 3. Replace with appropriate content from data sources
5. For checkboxes, use ☒ for checked, ☐ for unchecked
6. For tables, add rows as needed using same format
7. Remove empty conditional sections if not applicable
validation_checklist: Tables have proper structure and data
Complaint rates shown as percentages (not per 1,000)
No slot markers remaining in final document
